content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) producing {'iron-plate': 43} (warning: no ingredients to smelt)  
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)  
Use-case: Primary smelting station for converting raw materials into iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at (–16.0, –51.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0) (warnings: out of fuel, output blocked by item on the ground)  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5) (warning: out of fuel)  
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5) holding {'iron-ore': 146}  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5) (status: WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS)  
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5) (warning: not receiving electricity)  
– Fast Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5) (warning: not connected to power network)  
Use-case: Extraction and initial transport of iron ore for further processing.

### Copper Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0) (warning: no ingredients to smelt)  
Use-case: Intended for processing copper ore, though currently idle due to missing inputs.

### Lab Power Integration System at (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5) with lab_input {'automation-science-pack': 23}  
– Offshore Pump (original) at (–7.5, 25.5) (WORKING)  
– Offshore Pump (new) at (–9.5, 24.5) (WORKING, connected to the Boiler)  
– Boiler at (2.0, 17.5) with warnings: out of fuel, no input liquid, no fluid present in connections  
– Generator (Steam Engine) at (2.5, 27.5) with warnings: no input liquid, no fluid present in connections  
Note: The fluid pipeline between the Boiler and Steam Engine remains unresolved near (2.5, 21.5) with persistent congestion affecting new placement attempts.  
Use-case: Supports lab operations through power integration while attempting the fluid connection for steam engine generation.

### Pipe Production Facility at (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine at (3.5, 0.5) with warnings: not receiving electricity, cannot create pipe due to missing resource: iron-plate  
– Chest at (1.5, 0.5)  
– Distributed Small Electric Poles forming the power network  
Use-case: Manufactures pipes and maintains local material and power distribution.

### Fluid Pipelines (Multiple Pipe Groups)
Consists of:
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189393) spanning positions such as (–10.5, 22.5) to (–9.5, 23.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189398) at approximately (8.5, 5.5) with 2 pipe segments  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189399) at approximately (10.5, 4.5) with multiple segments  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189404) linking offshore pump (–9.5, 24.5) to the Boiler  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189407) at (2.5, 9.5) with a short chain of connections  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189408) at (10.5, 9.5) with secondary routing  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189414) at (1.5, 11.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189429) at (–1.5, 17.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189430) at (0.5, 17.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189432) at (6.5, 16.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189437) at (–1.5, 21.5) – potential congestion point  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189446) at (4.5, 25.5) with several pipe segments  
Use-case: Transports fluids between production components; persistent congestion near (2.5, 21.5) continues to hinder fluid connection attempts.

### Integrated Components
Consists of:
– BeltGroup connecting relevant inserter and belt outputs (6 belts total)  
– Electricity network via:
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57159) with poles at [(-10.5, -49.5), (-12.5, -48.5), (-12.5, -50.5)]  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57162) spanning positions near (3.5, 0.5)  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57172) with poles at [(6.5, 3.5), (5.5, 8.5)]  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57174) with poles at [(2.5, 30.5), (7.5, 26.5)]  
Use-case: Provides overall material handling via belts and supports factory operations with distributed power infrastructure.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fluid Pipeline Congestion  
 – The connection between the Boiler and Steam Engine remains unresolved due to persistent congestion at the lower connection (around (2.5, 21.5)), which repeatedly blocks new placement attempts.  
 – Mitigation: Reconfigure or relocate obstructing pipe groups; consider switching to underground pipelines or employing pipe-to-ground modules; reroute the fluid connection to a less congested area.

• Entity Placement and Collision Issues  
 – Numerous interfering pipe groups are causing collisions across multiple candidate placement directions (RIGHT, UP, LEFT, DOWN) with varying spacings.  
 – Mitigation: Verify that target tiles are unoccupied and ensure proper separation between entities prior to placement.

• Fuel, Resource, and Power Supply Shortfalls  
 – Multiple entities (e.g., Burner Mining Drills, Inserters, Furnaces, and Assembling Machines) display warnings related to being out of fuel, missing required ingredients, or lacking electrical connectivity.  
 – Mitigation: Ensure consistent replenishment of fuel and materials, and expand the power network to maintain stable operations.
